title: Android címjegyzék
creator: kurnyek.robert
content: A mobilos Thunderbird app-ban (10.1) nem jelenik meg a címjegyzék. Nincs erre felület? Hol található?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/138.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Edit as new on a message with an attachment does NOT include the attatchment.
creator: whitedavidp
content:
I use Edit as New on TB desktop all the time. It is great to have it on Android too.

But when I do this using a source message that has an attachment, the attachment is NOT brought across to the new message.

This has always worked on desktop. Is this a bug on Android?

Thanks
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) SamsungBrowser/28.0 Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Android 12

title: Message list missing many emails
creator: mswildma77
content: Starting in 10.1 and continuing with 11 and the beta for 12 the message list is missing numerous emails that are in my inbox that show in the desktop Thunderbird and my webmail. I never use threaded view so they are not mixed it and hidden that way, they are just not there. I have attached a screenshot of my inbox on the app and on the desktop and just from today you can see the difference. Also the color change from new to read is barely noticeable anymore.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/138.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36;os:Android

title: Incoming Emails Sometimes Lack Attachments
creator: whitedavidp
content:
Hi. I am finding, as I use TB Android more and more, that some messages - I know coming from gmail but perhaps also others - come in lacking attachments. In the message list I clearly see the paper clip icon. But when the message is opened I see no sign of an attachment anywhere. This is true even when I tap download complete message at the very bottom. But I can easily see it on the gmail website AND if I download the message into TB desktop.

Anyone have any idea what is happening here?

Thanks
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:135.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/135.0;os:Android 12
